intro: Martynia nelsoniana, commonly known as the Nelson's mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Martynia nelsoniana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
